column2: donna63, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was put on megace after 20 days of bleeding and at day 23 I was still bleeding some. Then on day 24 I started having cramps and started heavy bleeding again. I see my doctor in a couple days and I am just so frustrated, I am hoping that something can be figured out!

column2: Lar, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had major chest sugery due to cancer and a section of a lung was removed. The problem was I was in so much for a while I would not eat just waste away in bed.  It is my understanding that must cancer patients expire from malnutrition.  Well this stuff works for loss of appitite, I eat everything left over in the refreigator and I am gaining my weight back.

column2: Soulcrate, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: 37yrs.5 Children,UN-Employed,Survivor Squamous Cell Carcinoma(Cancer). 3rd Surgery,Tumor/Lesion removal (full) Testicular Re-construction,Skin Graph.I went from 165 lbs/6 ft. to 97 lbs. been on Megace for 1 month @120mg/1time daily(oral sus). I have Gained 20 lbs. 0 side effects, except for i cannot stop eating,and that's just fine W/me! a good support group, and a great attitude combined with the Doc's Genius/Med's,and Above all the Power of Prayer. living long and healthy IS POSSIBLE!!!Stay Active,Read Jokes,Make urself get up and around! Fight,Fight,Fight! God Bless You All.

column2: Soulcr8, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Only the first week,however incredable appitite Android that's what I need! My 65lbs. Back. My 3rd rodeo with squomous cell carcinoma.fight,fight,fight!

column2: Heatherrrrr, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My oncologist gave this to me for complex atypical endometrial hyperplasia (detected early), however, they could not rule out cancer when they first found it. When I had my D&C I was taking this for about 2 weeks. I am on a low dose, 80mg/day. My pathology results after my D&C WAS VASTLY IMPROVED (and no cancer!) and I feel the Megace has something to do with that. As for side effects I haven't had a pimple for almost 2 months now, my hair doesn't get greasy anymore (that's strange maybe but it's true), I get a cramp every few days, and sex is totally NOT interesting. Appetite is still normal, though. I strongly suggest taking this medicine despite the side effects!!!

column2: grneyes, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on this med twice and each time i start it,I get a green discharge.Has anybody else experienced this,and mood swings.I was put on it for pre-endometrial cancer.So far it has worked.

column2: csholtwick,  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
lous, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was on this medication for 21 months for endometrial stromal sarcoma.  I have two tumors growing in the recto-vaginal wall.  The medicine was supposed to shrink them however all it did was slow their growth.  I had terrible side effects: gained 25-30 pounds, crazy mood swings, serious depression, and high blood pressure.  I have to have a partial hysterectomy now anyway so I wish I would have never started on this medicine.  I have been off it for almost two months and still don't feel back to normal.

column2: Phyl, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am 47 and always maintained a weight of 105. When I had an appetite loss and dropped to 98lb I was devastated. My doctor put me on megace so I could gain some weight and it worked. I am so pleased to now weigh 125. I am a diabetic for 31 yrs. My side affects have been hair lose, vaginal itch, increased blood pressure and high blood sugar. Overall I am so satisfied with the weight gain that I deal with the side affects. I only take 1 to 2 dose a week to cut down on the side affects and that is enough to still give me an appetite to eat. Without it I have no appetite and have to force myself to eat just to compensate my insulin intake

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have only been on this medication for a few days.  I have been having a period for over five months, and was repeatedly told it was a reaction to my deprovara (which I have been taking for sometime, and have NEVER had this reaction with before). Shrugged off and sent on my merry little way, a month ago went to the ER due to extremely heavy bleeding and put on Reclipsen to regulate my hormones, diagnosed with dysfunctional uterine bleeding and once again patted on the head and sent on my merry little way.  Last week when on the placebo's for the reclipsen, I finally stopped bleeding for two whole days then started again.  I was admitted on wednesday to the hospital for a blood transfusion, and given the two choices of ablation and a hysterectomy, to solve my issues.  Until then I was given a D&C and was told by my doctor that it was to stop my bleeding during the two weeks before the hysterectomy.  I started bleeding once again yesterday morning, after less than 24 hours after the D&C, went back to the ER about it.  The doctor I saw there prescribed the Megace/Megestrol 40 mg tablets.  Since then I've had extreme diarrhea, lighted headedness, what feels like pressure on my chest, and between my weigh in yesterday and today somehow gained 7 lbs.  I would have to say, be VERY LEERY about taking this medication.  The side effects, aren't worth any potential benefits, as I've been doing this medication for two days and still bleeding. I am going to be refusing to take this medication after today again. Until I can speak to my own doctor, or a different on call doctor for my doctor's office.

column1: Cancer in the Lining of the Uterus
column2: Sil, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Constant bleeding from the uterus, clotting,the bleeding consumes my day.

column2: Cat, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took the drug for heavy bleeding. Was very agitated like bad PMS. My Dr reduced the dosage. Have severe calf and bicep pain. I would rather bleed. Not the drug for me

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was 112 pds when my doctor prescribed megace to me. i have always wanted to be 145 but was unable to gain weight on my own due to hiv. i have always very skinny and puny looking. after drinking megace for 2 weeks i had already gained 35 pds. i was so exstatic tht something had finally worked i didnt realize unhealthy it was. my heart rate increased and it a long time 4 it to get back normal. my stomach was huge... i looked like i was pregnant. my face swelled on one side and a had a double chin. i also bled for about 2 mths and had blood clots. this product almost cost me my life and i wish i never had taken. i am self concious now. i would do anything to go back tht i was. my metabolism has changed and i gain weight fast and i lose it fast. this medicine ruined my life and it should be banned. any1 looking to gain weight try doing it the healthy way unless you dont care about looking big & sloppy.

column1: Cancer in the Lining of the Uterus
column2: foodaven, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I took it because I have endometrial stromal sarcoma, a very rare cancer.I could not stand the weight gain, the headaches, the terrible pain in stomach, bp went sky high, then attacks of low blood sugar. Terrible fatigue like no other drug. I had to stop it after 3 months.

column2: Halo1, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Undiagnosed cyles bleeding over 3 months with clotting heavy flows.Hi I am 41..I have been miserable now since the end October 2009. My OBGYN was not very helpful.I had to do alot of research and become proactive on my pwn from being there little puppet with prescribed drugs but no answers on why?? I was bleeding. I became the puppet experiement.Go here for more info on the Drug megestrol acetate , http://www.answers.com/topic/megestrol-acetate-1 It talks about cancer and weight but also gives information on hormone drug what it does-side effects etc.. Pretty scary. I am currently back on this drug for 14 days.Although I have been bleeding myself heavily over 3 months without prognoses I finally had enough last week at Partner for Womens Health in Exeter NH & demanded answers & a fix. Then only was I finally going to get Lab work done. The only options I was given to stop the bleeding was Ablation or IUD..I dont think so !!! You havent even done my bloodwork to determine any factors of the reason for the bleeding. But so eager to give these options..WOW now thats scary! Being pretty much forced to go forth with a DNC I did schedule but only if necessary after the findings of Bloodwork & Ultrasound to determine if really needed for me to go through a DNC. I am sick of Dr.s treating us like puppets.Soooo I went home scheduled an appointment with my Primary care dr. for a 2nd opinion & then changed my OBGYN Dr

My reg doc said its artrist but I believe - that is her excuse for any that hurts. Help!

column2: Adaljisa, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The reason for taking this medication was to simply "gain weight".  All my life I have been very thin and have tried many products but this actually worked in such a short time frame.  However, the draw back is that I have been off this medication for some time now and unable to get pregnant.  I have discussed this with my gyn and this was one of the causes to the situation.  So, if there is anyone outthere who simply wants to put weight on, ask questions.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Gained a lot of weight , which dint' bother me but i think i ate so much i put my body into shock. I had the shakes for days. Stoped using megace after about 3 weeks,,,,gained 15 pounds and very content with that

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking this because I lost a signficant amount of weight being HIV.  I gained 25 lbs in 4 months.  It definitely puts fat and weight on you, which is fantastic.  POS - made my face look fuller (no more sunken in cheeks), gained overall weight to entire bodyNEG - i gained alot of weight in my stomach area, which was not appealing.  I had now developed a gut, which a problem for me. If you aren't body conscience or care about having a stomach/big gut, its a great product.  I have to get rid of the stomach that it gave me.  Before I was 127 and now I am 154.  That part has made me elated.  Now that I have gained the weight I needed, I am going off the product.  I am taking a weight gain product and start exercising.  My appetite is stimulated now, so I feel confident I can stop taking this product and with a strong work out program and the weight gain products, I will be able to maintain.  The good news now is that I won't have this stomach.  But overrall, if you have lost a signficant or alot of weight, your cheeks look sunken in, or overrall you just look frail due to HIV, I would highly recomment this product.

column2: tjonesey66,  Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The only bad thing I can say about Megace is the side effects for me were not great. It caused weight gain, but I was told it should go away after my surgery to correct my condition. But it did stop my problem of having extreme bleeding with my endometriosis.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I was put on megace to shrink a tumor,which it did. I also gained 30#. I was on it for 11yrs.I blame it for a cyst on my right ovary & one behind my rt knee.

column2: JoGee, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 51 and had a hysterectomy 20 years ago.  I am taking Megace to shrink what three gyno's think may be a tumor, hydrosalpinx or endometriosis.  My blood pressure shot up to 162/102.  I was at my family doctor and he put me on BP meds.  He says it is because of this medicine. I am very fit, but a little frightened of this drug. Any help?

column2: PoseyChild, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This drug saved my life!  I was losing weight due to cancer.  I had dropped 72 pounds over the course of 5 weeks.  My onocologist suggested this drug and it has reversed the appetite loss; I'm now gaining weight and my strength.

column2: Jackie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My 87 yo mother was put on Megace for appetite stimulation following a stroke.Be fore going on this, she was able to talk and carry on a conversation, one week post stroke.After three days on this,she had mood swings,seemed unable to talk, and these symptoms increased,she was on it for 3 weeks until I insisted it be stopped.She also was nauseous and barely able to hold up her head.I feel she had another stroke while on this medication and it was undetected by the rehab facility,as she has never regained the level she was at before taking this.

column2: dbat, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year
column9: I was given this drug because of heavy bleeding w/periods because of fibroids.  I had recent heart attack and was placed on ASA/Plavix. Am 48yrs old had only had bleeding/anemia as a symptom.  Uterus was 10 wk size, put on Megace daily about 5 weeks after my last period and didn't have a period until 3 wks later. It was a lighter period that lasted 4 wks.  I had a week off and started with bleeding small amounts daily.  Normal endo Bx and Fibroids have grown 2cm which I now feel abdominal pressure/bloating.  Which is new for me.  I am sure it is related to Megace.  My Gyno now recomends a hysterectomy because of the continued bleeding. I just went off it hoping that my periods will return regularly however the more I read the more I'm really uncertain.  I absolutely would not have gone on the Megace knowing what I know now.  I would have dealt with the incovnience of a heavy bleeding for 1-2 days versus the hormonal stuff.

column2: sep4leaf, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been off this for 10 years.  After the birth of my son I cannot lose weight and have a thyroid condition.  I beleive the megace ruined my metabolism.

column9: this drug caused me to develope blood clots
